concepts.teaching_method: Bhakri (flatbread) divided into 2 equal parts = 1/2. Numerator = parts taken, Denominator = total parts. Watermelon cut into 6 parts, 3 given = 3/6.
visuals: Photo of bhakri cut in half
Bhakri cut into 4 parts with 2 separated
concepts.simulation_idea: Interactive bhakri/watermelon cutting — tap to divide, see fraction update

concepts.teaching_method: 1/2 = 2/4 = 3/6 shown via bhakri divided into 2, 4, 6 parts. Two circles showing 2/3 = 4/6. Rectangle with 2/5 = 6/15 via subdivision.
visuals: Two circles: one in 3 parts (2 shaded), one in 6 parts (4 shaded)
concepts.key_rule: Fractions that look different but represent the same amount are called equivalent fractions (सममूल्य अपूर्णांक)
concepts.simulation_idea: Side-by-side shapes that subdivide while keeping same shaded area

concepts.teaching_method: Dialogue between teacher (शिक्षिका), Sonu, Nandu. 2/5 to 6/15: multiply both by 3. Rule: multiply numerator AND denominator by same non-zero number.
worked_examples: Find equivalent of 5/6 with denominator 30 → 5/6 = 25/30 (multiply by 5)
concepts.key_rule_mr: अपूर्णांकाच्या अंशाला व छेदाला एकाच संख्येने गुणल्यास सममूल्य अपूर्णांक मिळतो
concepts.simulation_idea: Animated multiplier — drag a x2, x3 badge onto a fraction and watch both numbers change while bar stays same

concepts.teaching_method: Nandu asks if we can divide too. Teacher confirms: 6/15 ÷ 3 = 2/5. Dividing both by common factor gives equivalent fraction.
worked_examples: Find equivalent of 15/40 with denominator 8 → 15/40 = 3/8 (divide both by 5)
concepts.simulation_idea: Reverse animation — complex fraction simplifies as divider is applied, bars merge

concepts.teaching_method: Definition: fractions with same denominator. Example: 1/7, 4/7, 6/7 are like fractions.
concepts.simulation_idea: Visual grouping — fractions with same denominator glow same color and group together

concepts.teaching_method: Definition: fractions with different denominators. Example: 1/3, 4/8, 9/11 are unlike fractions.
concepts.simulation_idea: Contrasting visual — unlike fractions shown with different-sized bars

concepts.name_en: Converting Unlike Fractions to Like Fractions
concepts.teaching_method: Find common multiple of denominators. Convert both fractions. Examples: 5/6 and 7/9 → common denom 18 → 15/18 and 14/18. Also: 4/8 and 5/16 → denom 16 → 8/16 and 5/16. Also: 4/7 and 3/4 → denom 28 → 16/28 and 21/28.
concepts.simulation_idea: Two bars with different divisions animate to match — bars subdivide until denominators align

concepts.teaching_method: Strip with 5 parts: 3 colored vs 2 colored → 3/5 > 2/5. Strip with 8 parts: 3 vs 4 → 3/8 < 4/8. Rule: same denominator → larger numerator = larger fraction.
concepts.key_rule_mr: समच्छेद अपूर्णांकांमध्ये, ज्याचा अंश मोठा तो अपूर्णांक मोठा असतो
concepts.simulation_idea: Two strips fill with color — obvious visual comparison

concepts.teaching_method: Three strips all with 2 parts shaded: 2/3, 2/4, 2/5. Shows 2/3 > 2/4 > 2/5. Rule: same numerator → larger denominator = smaller fraction.
concepts.key_rule_mr: समान अंश असलेल्या अपूर्णांकांमध्ये ज्या अपूर्णांकाचा छेद मोठा असतो तो अपूर्णांक लहान असतो
concepts.simulation_idea: Three identical shapes with same shading count but different total divisions — visual proof

concepts.teaching_method: Analogy: two children on blocks of different heights — equalize blocks first. Similarly, convert to like fractions then compare. Example: 3/5 vs 4/7 → 21/35 vs 20/35 → 3/5 > 4/7.
visuals: Illustration of two children on different-height blocks
concepts.key_rule_mr: अपूर्णांकांचे छेद भिन्न असतील तर त्यांचे समान छेद असणारे सममूल्य अपूर्णांक तयार करून तुलना करावी
concepts.simulation_idea: Two children on adjustable blocks — blocks equalize, then height comparison is obvious

concepts.teaching_method: Strip with 7 parts: 3 striped + 2 dotted = 5/7. Rule: add numerators, keep denominator. Examples: 3/7+2/7=5/7, 3/8+2/8+1/8=6/8.
concepts.key_rule_mr: समच्छेद अपूर्णांकांची बेरीज करताना अंशांची बेरीज करतात व छेद तसाच लिहितात
concepts.simulation_idea: Colored segments slide together in a bar, fraction equation builds itself

concepts.teaching_method: 2/6 + 4/6 = 6/6 = 1 whole. When numerator = denominator, value = 1. Therefore 7/7=1, 10/10=1, 1=1/1=2/2=3/3.
concepts.key_rule_mr: अपूर्णांकाचे अंश व छेद समान असतील, तर त्या अपूर्णांकाची किमत 1 असते
concepts.simulation_idea: Bar fills completely — all segments colored — morphs into '1' with celebration

concepts.teaching_method: Shape with 5 parts, 4 shaded. Erase 1 = 4/5 - 1/5 = 3/5. Rule: subtract numerators, keep denominator. Examples: 7/13-5/13=2/13.
visuals: Strip showing 4/5 with one part erased = 3/5
concepts.key_rule_mr: वजाबाकी करताना अंशांची वजाबाकी करून छेद तसाच लिहितात
word_problems: Raju got 5/12, Sanju got 3/12. How much more did Raju get? → 2/12
Wall 7/10 to paint, 4/10 done. How much left? → 3/10
concepts.simulation_idea: Eraser tool removes colored segments from a bar — fraction decreases

visuals: Strip showing 2/3 converting to 4/6 then adding 1/6
concepts.simulation_idea: Two bars with different divisions — one bar animates to match the other's divisions, then segments combine
Same as unlike addition but in reverse — segments removed after conversion

concepts.teaching_method: 1/4 of 20 dots = 5. 1/2 of 20 = 10. 3/4 of 20: find 1/4 first (=5), then ×3 = 15. Real-world: Ramu travels 20km, 4/5 by car = 16km.
visuals: Grid of 20 dots with groups highlighted
word_problems: Find 1/3 of 15 pencils, 21 balloons, 9 boys, 18 books
Find 1/5 of 20 rupees, 30 km, 15 liters, 25 cm
concepts.simulation_idea: Grid of objects — tap fraction and objects highlight/separate into groups

concepts.teaching_method: 5's double = 10, so 1/2 of 10 = 5. 5's triple = 15, so 1/3 of 15 = 5. Multiplication and fractions are inverse operations.
concepts.simulation_idea: Marbles multiply into rows, then fraction divides them back — visual inverse

concepts.teaching_method: Three half-circles = 1/2+1/2+1/2 = 3/2 = 1½. A mixed number has whole part + fraction part. Examples: 2¼, 3⅖, 7⁴⁄₉.
visuals: Three circles each half-shaded combining to show 1½
concepts.key_term_mr: पूर्णांकयुक्त अपूर्णांक — पूर्ण भाग + अपूर्णांक भाग
concepts.simulation_idea: Circles fill beyond 1 whole — overflow creates new circle + fraction label

concepts.teaching_method: When numerator > denominator: 3/2, 5/3 are improper fractions.
concepts.simulation_idea: Bar that overflows its bounds — numerator literally shown as larger

concepts.name_en: Converting Improper Fractions to Mixed Numbers
concepts.simulation_idea: Fraction splits apart — whole number separates from remainder fraction

exercises.name: उदाहरणसंग्रह 17
exercises.sub_parts: Q1 has 8 sub-parts, Q2-Q5 have 4-8 each

activities.description: Illustration of crowd wearing caps. Color 1/3 red, 3/5 blue. Count each.
Make circular spinner divided into 6 equal colored parts. Spin to see color mixing.

story.description: Poet visits king, 3 guards demand fractions of reward (1/10, 2/5, 1/2). Poet asks for 100 lashes. Guards get lashes. King rewards poet with gold.

humor.description: Nandu jokes about 1½ wise men — mixed fractions humor
